title: Ping spikes, game freezing and constant error messages since patch 6.9
body:
First of all, I know my internet was laggy in the first place, however I've been using  THREE different wifi connections and it happens no matter what wifi I'm on. Starbucks, my school wifi, and home wifi. Normally my connection would be very good at Starbucks except the occasional 5000ms short term spikes when it gets the busiest with a ton of laptops. With the patch I've noticed these ping changes:

=Average ping=
Before:              Patch 6.9:
NA: 80-120-------->220-300/350
OCE: 180-250---> 280-350        200-250 ping is playable for me, but 350+ spikes are not. 

I was pretty used to high ping but now its just getting annoying. Ahaha. League has also been freezing occasionally with my ping and fps staying the same. (only happened once to be fair, but I couldn't reconnect to the game after because of the network error connection everyone else is complaining about.) Already tried the support techniques. It's not just my wifi. Too coincidental.

replies.body: Same. since the new patch im getting random periods where my ping goes from 45 then spikes randomly to 500-1000 for like 10-20 seconds then drops back to normal.

To get a better idea of what the root cause could be, where are you playing from exactly?  Given your location and your ISP, it may explain why your ping is much higher than it normally is.

Reply back and let me know!
Portland, OR area. Xfinity and Whiz to Coho are the ISPs I believe.
Portland, OR?  I play in Vancouver, WA. Hi neighbor!
Yep! Hello neighbor! How's the weather over there? ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
It's great!  I love the rain came back to water my lawns. :D

Could you specify the specific ISP you use?

Additionally, can you run a [tracert to the NA Servers](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674#wq2) and copy/paste the results here?  It should give us a better idea!

> [{quoted}](name=dArtagnan,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=ZA4GUjUa,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-10T23:33:36.445+0000)
>
> To get a better idea of what the root cause could be, where are you playing from exactly?  Given your location and your ISP, it may explain why your ping is much higher than it normally is.
> 
> Reply back and let me know!

I've been seeing the same behavior here, lag spikes with stable framerate & ping that only started with this patch and which haven't gone away after several days now.  I'm in Phoenix on Cox.

Tracing route to 192.64.170.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

[local network omitted]
  3     7 ms     7 ms     8 ms  100.127.65.128
  4     9 ms     8 ms     8 ms  70.169.73.90

  6    34 ms    19 ms    20 ms  72.215.224.162
  7    27 ms    27 ms    27 ms  104.160.133.35
  8    66 ms    65 ms    65 ms  ae36-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.66]
  9    58 ms    59 ms    59 ms  104.160.131.34
 10    66 ms    65 ms    65 ms  104.160.131.46
 11    65 ms    67 ms    73 ms  104.160.131.103
 12     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 13     *        *       67 ms  192.64.170.1
I have had no difficulties pre patch 6.9. I get the error messages, my friends list is all out of sorts. And i also experience the lag spikes exactly as he describes. Its only happens in League.
I get serious drop in team fights - shit just stops moving then fast forwards and I'm dead lol.
